carousel_items: Can cause loss of coordination, confusion, uncontrollable eye movements, and unwanted hair growth while on this.
If you’re taking supplements, let your doctor know. You’ll likely have to space out the supplements and Dilantin so they don’t interact.
If you start having skin rashes or thoughts of suicide, tell your doctor immediately.
Makes many drugs less effective, so make sure your doctor has a complete list of what you’re taking.
If you need to stop taking Dilantin, do so over at least one week to prevent withdrawal seizures.

basics.benefits_moa: Dilantin is an antiepileptic medication. It prevents seizures by stabilizing brain cells and lowering abnormal communication within the brain.
basics.bottom_line: Dilantin is effective at preventing seizures, but has many drug interactions and side effects. If your blood tests show that you have the right amount of Dilantin levels, you’ll have a lower chance of getting side effects.
downsides: Need to get blood tests regularly to make sure Dilantin has safe and effective levels in your body.
Can cause changes in your appearance, such as unwanted hair growth, enlargement of the gums, and coarsening of your facial features.
If you have kidney problems, your dose and kidney function will have to be checked regularly to make sure Dilantin levels don’t get too high.
Can make many other medicines less effective, including birth control.

downsides_processed.orig: Need to get blood tests regularly to make sure Dilantin has safe and effective levels in your body.
Can cause changes in your appearance, such as unwanted hair growth, enlargement of the gums, and coarsening of your facial features.
If you have kidney problems, your dose and kidney function will have to be checked regularly to make sure Dilantin levels don’t get too high.
Can make many other medicines less effective, including birth control.

upsides: Dilantin is effective at preventing seizures, and treating seizures in an emergency.
Available in an oral suspension and chewable tablets if you have trouble swallowing capsules.

upsides_processed.orig: Dilantin is effective at preventing seizures, and treating seizures in an emergency.
Available in an oral suspension and chewable tablets if you have trouble swallowing capsules.

userStories.tip: I  take  three 100MG  capsules  in the morning and  2  100MG  capsules at  bedtime
I take a generic form of Dilantin. I have been on therapy for over 15 years. Planning to stop taking the medicine because I am concerned about bone loss and cognitive side effects.

drugs.name: Dilantin

carousel_items_processed.orig: Can cause loss of coordination, confusion, uncontrollable eye movements, and unwanted hair growth while on this.
If you’re taking supplements, let your doctor know. You’ll likely have to space out the supplements and Dilantin so they don’t interact.
If you start having skin rashes or thoughts of suicide, tell your doctor immediately.
Makes many drugs less effective, so make sure your doctor has a complete list of what you’re taking.
If you need to stop taking Dilantin, do so over at least one week to prevent withdrawal seizures.

risks_warnings.title: Skin reactions
risks_warnings.description: Dilantin has been linked to severe, life-threatening skin reactions, including toxic epidermal necrolysis (TEN) and Stevens-Johnson syndrome (SJS). If you notice a rash or any other skin changes while taking Dilantin, let your doctor know immediately.

description_processed.orig: Dilantin has been linked to severe, life-threatening skin reactions, including toxic epidermal necrolysis (TEN) and Stevens-Johnson syndrome (SJS). If you notice a rash or any other skin changes while taking Dilantin, let your doctor know immediately.

risks_warnings.title: Serious liver damage
risks_warnings.description: Dilantin may cause an extreme allergic reaction that can damage the liver, though it's very rare. If you start noticing an unusual skin rash, swollen lymph nodes, or a fever, seek medical attention immediately.
risk_factors: Starting Dilantin within the first two months

description_processed.orig: Dilantin may cause an extreme allergic reaction that can damage the liver, though it's very rare. If you start noticing an unusual skin rash, swollen lymph nodes, or a fever, seek medical attention immediately.

risks_warnings.title: Cardiovascular risk with fast IV infusions
risks_warnings.description: If you're receiving Dilantin through an intravenous (IV) line, there's a risk of heart problems, such as low blood pressure and abnormal heart rhythms. Most likely you'll be in the hospital if you're getting Dilantin through an IV line, so your doctors and nurses will make sure you receive the medicine very slowly and will monitor you carefully.

description_processed.orig: If you're receiving Dilantin through an intravenous (IV) line, there's a risk of heart problems, such as low blood pressure and abnormal heart rhythms. Most likely you'll be in the hospital if you're getting Dilantin through an IV line, so your doctors and nurses will make sure you receive the medicine very slowly and will monitor you carefully.

risks_warnings.title: Changes in blood cells
risks_warnings.description: Although rare, Dilantin may lower the amount of important blood cells in your body, such as white blood cells, platelets, and red blood cells. You should be getting regular blood tests to make sure your blood cells don't change too much while taking Dilantin.

description_processed.orig: Although rare, Dilantin may lower the amount of important blood cells in your body, such as white blood cells, platelets, and red blood cells. You should be getting regular blood tests to make sure your blood cells don't change too much while taking Dilantin.

risks_warnings.title: Suicidal thoughts or behavior
risks_warnings.description: Dilantin may increase the risk of suicidal thoughts or behavior as early as one week after starting treatment. Watch for the start or worsening of depression, suicidal thoughts or behavior, or any unusual changes in mood or behavior. Report anything concerning to a doctor immediately.

description_processed.orig: Dilantin may increase the risk of suicidal thoughts or behavior as early as one week after starting treatment. Watch for the start or worsening of depression, suicidal thoughts or behavior, or any unusual changes in mood or behavior. Report anything concerning to a doctor immediately.

risks_warnings.title: Bone fractures due to weakened bones
risks_warnings.description: Taking Dilantin for a long time has been associated with reduced bone mineral density, fractures, and osteoporosis. Your doctor may monitor your bone mineral density regularly and start you on calcium or vitamin D supplements.

description_processed.orig: Taking Dilantin for a long time has been associated with reduced bone mineral density, fractures, and osteoporosis. Your doctor may monitor your bone mineral density regularly and start you on calcium or vitamin D supplements.

risks_warnings.title: Withdrawal seizures
risks_warnings.description: Stopping Dilantin suddenly can increase the number of seizures. If you want to stop taking Dilantin, talk to your doctor before making any changes. It’s safer to slowly lower your dose of the drug over at least one week before completely stopping.

description_processed.orig: Stopping Dilantin suddenly can increase the number of seizures. If you want to stop taking Dilantin, talk to your doctor before making any changes. It’s safer to slowly lower your dose of the drug over at least one week before completely stopping.

carousel_items: You can experience drowsiness, weakness, dizziness, or respiratory infections while on this.
If you start having skin rashes or changes in your mood, tell your doctor immediately.
If you need to stop taking Keppra, do so over at least one week to prevent withdrawal seizures.
If you are taking the oral solution, use the measuring device given with the medicine. Don’t use your household tablespoons to measure.
Don’t crush or cut this medicine before taking it, or else you’ll have dangerously high levels of this drug in your body.

basics.benefits_moa: Keppra is an antiepileptic medication. It prevents seizures by helping regulate neurotransmitters in the brain.
basics.bottom_line: Keppra is effective for preventing seizures in people with epilepsy. Compared to other anti-seizure medications, it has few drug interactions and you don’t need to get your levels checked.
downsides: It’s important to take your dose on time so that Keppra has consistent levels in your body.
May not be the best drug to take if you have a history of psychiatric issues, such as depression or bipolar disorder.
If you have kidney problems, your dose may need to be adjusted. Your doctor will check your kidney function regularly.
Keppra is only FDA-approved to be taken with other medicines to treat epilepsy.

downsides_processed.orig: It’s important to take your dose on time so that Keppra has consistent levels in your body.
May not be the best drug to take if you have a history of psychiatric issues, such as depression or bipolar disorder.
If you have kidney problems, your dose may need to be adjusted. Your doctor will check your kidney function regularly.
Keppra is only FDA-approved to be taken with other medicines to treat epilepsy.

upsides: Lowers the frequency of seizures, including partial-onset, generalized tonic-clonic, and myoclonic seizures.
Unlike many other medications for epilepsy, this has very few drug interactions, so your other medicines shouldn't be affected.
If you have trouble swallowing tablets, Keppra is also available as an oral solution.
You won’t need to get regular blood tests to check the drug levels in your body.

upsides_processed.orig: Lowers the frequency of seizures, including partial-onset, generalized tonic-clonic, and myoclonic seizures.
Unlike many other medications for epilepsy, this has very few drug interactions, so your other medicines shouldn't be affected.
If you have trouble swallowing tablets, Keppra is also available as an oral solution.
You won’t need to get regular blood tests to check the drug levels in your body.

userStories.tip: I personally couldn't tolerate alcohol at all while on medication as it amplifies the side effect of drowsiness considerably.

My daughter has been taking Keppra since her seizures began over two years ago.  She began with 500mg and has slowly increased due to continued seizures to now 2500mg daily. No side effects with mostly success at this level for over a year.

userStories.satisfaction: Not worth it, thinking about stopping
userStories.tip: I was on Keppra for 11 years, stopped 1 year ago. It caused depression. I stayed on it to focus on my career and got off at semi-retirement. Getting off it took one year; lowering the dose (very slowly) to below 1/2 caused awful seizures.

drugs.name: Keppra

carousel_items_processed.orig: You can experience drowsiness, weakness, dizziness, or respiratory infections while on this.
If you start having skin rashes or changes in your mood, tell your doctor immediately.
If you need to stop taking Keppra, do so over at least one week to prevent withdrawal seizures.
If you are taking the oral solution, use the measuring device given with the medicine. Don’t use your household tablespoons to measure.
Don’t crush or cut this medicine before taking it, or else you’ll have dangerously high levels of this drug in your body.

risks_warnings.title: Blood disorders
risks_warnings.description: Although rare, Keppra may lower the amount of important blood cells in your body (hemoglobin, hematocrit, white blood cells, and neutrophils). You should be getting regular blood tests to make sure your blood cells don't change too much while taking Keppra.

description_processed.orig: Although rare, Keppra may lower the amount of important blood cells in your body (hemoglobin, hematocrit, white blood cells, and neutrophils). You should be getting regular blood tests to make sure your blood cells don't change too much while taking Keppra.

risks_warnings.title: Life-threatnening skin reactions
risks_warnings.description: Keppra has been linked to severe, life-threatening skin reactions, including toxic epidermal necrolysis (TEN) and Stevens-Johnson syndrome (SJS). If you notice a rash or any other skin changes while taking Keppra, let your doctor know immediately.

description_processed.orig: Keppra has been linked to severe, life-threatening skin reactions, including toxic epidermal necrolysis (TEN) and Stevens-Johnson syndrome (SJS). If you notice a rash or any other skin changes while taking Keppra, let your doctor know immediately.

risks_warnings.title: Suicidal thoughts or behavior
risks_warnings.description: Keppra may increase the risk of suicidal thoughts or behavior as early as one week after starting treatment. Watch for the start or worsening of depression, suicidal thoughts or behavior, or any unusual changes in mood or behavior. Report anything concerning to a doctor immediately.

description_processed.orig: Keppra may increase the risk of suicidal thoughts or behavior as early as one week after starting treatment. Watch for the start or worsening of depression, suicidal thoughts or behavior, or any unusual changes in mood or behavior. Report anything concerning to a doctor immediately.

risks_warnings.title: Driving impairment
risks_warnings.description: Taking Keppra can make you feel sleepy, dizzy, and affect your coordination. Avoid activities that require you to be alert, such as driving a car or operating machinery, until you know how Keppra affects you.
risk_factors: Starting the first month of therapy
Taking other medicines that make you less alert

description_processed.orig: Taking Keppra can make you feel sleepy, dizzy, and affect your coordination. Avoid activities that require you to be alert, such as driving a car or operating machinery, until you know how Keppra affects you.

risks_warnings.title: Withdrawal seizures
risks_warnings.description: Stopping Keppra suddenly can increase the number of seizures. If you want to stop taking Keppra, talk to your doctor before making any changes. It’s safer to slowly lower your dose of the drug over at least one week before completely stopping.

description_processed.orig: Stopping Keppra suddenly can increase the number of seizures. If you want to stop taking Keppra, talk to your doctor before making any changes. It’s safer to slowly lower your dose of the drug over at least one week before completely stopping.

risks_warnings.title: Psychiatric side effects
risks_warnings.description: Keppra may change your mood and behavior. Watch out for any changes, such as increased aggression or hostility, depression, anxiety, or rapid shifts in your mood (emotional lability). Let your doctor know if you experience these changes.

description_processed.orig: Keppra may change your mood and behavior. Watch out for any changes, such as increased aggression or hostility, depression, anxiety, or rapid shifts in your mood (emotional lability). Let your doctor know if you experience these changes.
